rows.text: Teleplay by: Anne Collins Story by: Dean Hargrove & Joel Steiger
Teleplay by: Anne Collins Story by: Dean Hargrove & Joel Steiger
Matlock and Julie both agree to defend the jealous woman (Pamela Galloway) who's charged of murdering her husband. Note: Nancy Stafford and Kene Holliday do not appear in this episode.

When the brother of the dead convict (Mitchell Laurance) holds Michelle hostage, both Tyler and Julie must not allow Ned Billings to kill Matlock. Note: This episode is featured in an anthology-style reviewing the pilot episode "The Diary of a Perfect Murder", Season 2 episodes "Blind Justice", with the 2-part episode "The Investigation", followed by the rest of the Season 1 episodes "The People Vs. Matlock", "The Stripper", "The Court-Martial", "The Seduction", "The Sisters", all episodes as to explain how Michelle, Julie and Tyler enjoyed working for Matlock. It concluded with "The Professor" the only episode within the context of trying to find out why Ned's brother had hung himself in jail, after he was found guilty for the murder. Andy Griffith appears briefly at the end of the episode.

When a man (Tony Maggio) is determined to bring back the sixties is accused of murdering the mayor, Matlock travels to Chicago to represent him. Note: Julie Sommars does not appear in this episode.

After Paul O'Neill (Tony Soper) found Jackie Chan (Evan C. Kim) dead, he fled to Matlock in asking him for money to go to Texas to follow Eddie Lomax (Alan Stock), knowing he'd be the real killer, before his own murder in prison. In Chicago, Matlock notices that the real estate scam is responsible for everything, and enlists the mayor's wife as his main ally. Note: Julie Sommars does not appear in this episode.

Being convicted for seven years for killing his wife (Debra Stipe), Ken Wilson (Jeff Allin) approaches the same woman in Los Angeles, only to change her name to Kelly Manning. When the wife of an obsessive convictee is dead, a second time, Ken's this time being arrested for that murder. In Atlanta, Les is more than happy with his new girlfriend Bernice, whom he met at Ray Templin's bar. Note: Julie Sommars and Nancy Stafford do not appear in this episode.
